pos:

The tower dominates the frame, its silhouette sharply defined against the vibrant colors of the evening sky. The sky transitions from a deep purplish-blue at the top to a lighter, almost pinkish hue near the horizon, suggesting either sunrise or sunset. Wispy clouds streak across the sky, adding texture and depth to the background. 


The clock face itself is distinctly visible, with its Roman numerals and hands clearly showing the time. The golden color of the clock contrasts with the dark silhouette of the tower, creating a striking visual effect. The architectural details of the tower are partially visible, with the intricate stonework and decorative elements suggestive of Gothic architecture. A smaller section of the building is seen to the lower left, suggesting the broader context of the Houses of Parliament. 


Two faint contrails are visible in the upper right and lower left corners of the sky, adding an element of movement and hinting at the passage of time. The overall composition is dramatic, with the dark, imposing structure contrasting sharply with the vibrant, colorful sky. The image has a slightly surreal quality due to the strong contrast and the somewhat unusual color saturation of the sky.

It specifies the building's name for precise results.
